Reason: The configuration option 'memtable_cleanup_threshold' is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because the value of 'memtable_cleanup_threshold' directly impacts the ratio of occupied non-flushing memtable size to total permitted size, which in turn triggers a flush of the largest memtable. This operation is time-expensive and memory-expensive as it affects the flushing behavior of memtables, leading to notable performance variations at the system level. The code context provided shows that the 'cleaningThreshold' value is fetched from 'DatabaseDescriptor.getMemtableCleanupThreshold()', which is crucial for determining the behavior of the MemtablePool. Therefore, any changes in the 'memtable_cleanup_threshold' configuration can have a substantial impact on system performance.
